title: Update regarding GENE
story_body:
"Gene Editing Stocks Get Sliced as Supply Chain Snags Take Hold

The gene editing sector is getting slammed, and GENE is the latest bagholder. Industry-wide shortages are crippling the space, sending shockwaves through the market. It's a sector issue, folks, and it's not just GENE that's feeling the pain.

As a trader, you've got to be paying attention to the supply chain. When the dominos start falling, you can bet your bottom dollar the stock price is going to take a hit. And let me tell you, GENE is taking it on the chin. The stock is getting pummeled, and it's anyone's guess how low it'll go.

The problem is, nobody saw this coming. Or at least, nobody wanted to see it coming. Gene editing was supposed to be the next big thing, the moonshot that would send these stocks soaring to the moon. But now, it's looking like a sector-wide implosion.

The shortages are affecting everyone, from big pharma to tiny biotechs. Nobody's immune, and that's what's got investors running for cover. It's a classic case of 'sell first, ask questions later.' And when the dust settles, you can bet there'll be some serious bagholders left in the wake.

GENE's not alone, of course. The whole sector's getting hit. But when you're a trader, you don't care about the sector - you care about your stock. And if you're long GENE, you're probably feeling like you've been punched in the gut.

The question now is, how low will it go? Will GENE find a bottom, or will it keep sliding? Only time will tell. But one thing's for sure: this is a sector issue, and it's not going away anytime soon. So buckle up, traders - it's going to be a bumpy ride."
